Field Label: Researcher doing risk assessment
Date of IDS risk follow-up

1. Change from normal?
Is it a constant state? Or has anything happened recently to cause these thoughts?

2. Plans and availability of methods
a) Any current plans about committing suicide? YES - have you taken any actions towards pursuing these plans (eg, bought medication)?
b) Anything stopping you from doing this?

3. Self-harm and recurrence
a) Have you self-harmed in the past?
b) How long ago was the last suicide attempt?

4. Professional support
Are you in touch with mental health services/GP about this? When did you see them last? What kind of support are you receiving?

5. Family / social support
Is there someone else you can talk to about these feelings?

6. Feeling safe?
Do you feel safe? What do you do if you don't?

*7. Reasons
If a reason for suicide comes up ask for details
Other notes on suicidal thoughs

Field Label: Date of assessment
Depression episode verified?
In the past <U>three months</U> (or from the date that they answered the OA), has there been a period of time where you were feeling depressed or down most of the day or nearly every day?
When has this period roughly started and finished?
During that time, did you have less interest or pleasure in things you usually enjoyed?
Has this lasted for as long as two weeks?
Focusing on the worst 2 week period, have you had any change in sleeping or appetite?
Just before this period of symptoms began, were you physically ill?
Were you taking any medications?
Has there been any changes to the amount you were taking?
Have you sought help from anyone to help deal with these feelings (e.g. GP)? Do you have a plan going forward?

Section Header: Please indicate the one response to each item that best describes you for the past seven days.
Field Label: 1. Falling asleep
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I never take longer than 30 minutes to fall asleep | 1, I take at least 30 minutes to fall asleep, less than half the time | 2, I take at least 30 minutes to fall asleep, more than half the time | 3, I take more than 60 minutes to fall asleep, more than half the time

Field Label: 2. Sleep during the night
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I do not wake up at night | 1, I have a restless, light sleep with a few brief awakenings each night | 2, I wake up at least once a night, but I go back to sleep easily | 3, I awaken more than once a night and stay awake for 20 minutes or more, more than half the time

Field Label: 3. Waking up too early
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Most of the time, I awaken no more than 30 minutes before I need to get up | 1, More than half the time, I awaken more than 30 minutes before I need to get up | 2, I almost always awaken at least one hour or so before I need to, but I go back to sleep eventually | 3, I awaken at least one hour before I need to, and can not go back to sleep

Field Label: 4. Sleeping too much
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I sleep no longer than 7-8 hours per night without napping during the day | 1, I sleep no longer than 10 hours in a 24 hour period, including naps | 2, I sleep no longer than 12 hours in a 24-hour period, including naps | 3, I sleep longer than 12 hours in a 24-hour period, including naps

Field Label: 5. Feeling sad
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I do not feel sad | 1, I feel sad less than half the time | 2, I feel sad more than half the time | 3, I feel sad nearly all of the time

Field Label: 6. Feeling irritable
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I do not feel irritable | 1, I feel irritable less than half the time | 2, I feel irritable more than half the time | 3, I feel extremely irritable nearly all of the time

Field Label: 7. Feeling anxious or tense
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I do not feel anxious or tense | 1, I feel anxious (tense) less than half the time | 2, I feel anxious (tense) more than half the time | 3, I feel extremely anxious (tense) nearly all of the time

Field Label: 8. Response of your mood to good or desired events
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, My mood brightens to a normal level which lasts for several hours when good events occur | 1, My mood brightens but I do not feel like my normal self when good events occur | 2, My mood brightens only somewhat to a rather limited range of desired events | 3, My mood does not brighten at all, even when very good or desired events occur in my life

Field Label: 9. Your mood in relation to time of day
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, There is no regular relationship between my mood and the time of day | 1, My mood often relates to the time of day because of environmental events (e.g., being alone, working) | 2, In general, my mood is more related to the time of day than to environmental events | 3, My mood is clearly and predictably better or worse at a particular time each day

Field Label: 10. Is your mood typically worse in the morning, afternoon or night?
11. Is your mood variation attributed to the environment?
12. The quality of your mood
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, The mood (internal feelings) that I experience is very much a normal mood | 1, My mood is sad, but this sadness is pretty much like the sad mood I would feel if someone close to me died or left | 2, My mood is sad, but this sadness has a rather different quality to it than the sadness I would feel if someone close to me died or left | 3, My mood is sad, but this sadness is different from the type of sadness associated with grief or loss

Section Header: Please indicate the one response to each item that best describes you for the past seven days. Please complete 13 or 14 (not both).
Field Label: 13. Decreased appetite
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, There is no change in my usual appetite | 1, I eat somewhat less often or lesser amounts of food than usual | 2, I eat much less than usual and only with personal effort | 3, I rarely eat within a 24-hour period, and only with extreme personal effort or when others persuade me to eat
Field Note: Please fill out either question 13 or 14, not both.

Field Label: 14. Increased appetite
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, There is no change in my usual appetite | 1, I feel a need to eat more frequently than usual | 2, I regularly eat more often and/or greater amounts of food than usual | 3, I feel driven to overeat both at mealtime and between meals
Field Note: Please fill out either question 13 or 14, not both.

Section Header: Please indicate the one response to each item that best describes you for the past two weeks. Please complete 15 or 16 (not both).
Field Label: 15. Within the last two weeks
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I have not had a change in my weight | 1, I feel as if I've had a slight weight loss | 2, I have lost 2 pounds (1 kg) or more | 3, I have lost 5 pounds (2.5 kg) or more
Field Note: Please fill out either question 15 or 16, not both.

Field Label: 16. Within the last two weeks
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I have not had a change in my weight | 1, I feel as if I've had a slight weight gain | 2, I have gained 2 pounds (1kg) or more | 3, I have gained 5 pounds (2.5 kg) or more
Field Note: Please fill out either question 15 or 16, not both.

Section Header: Please indicate the one response to each item that best describes you for the past seven days.
Field Label: 17. Concentration/decision making
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, There is no change in my usual capacity to concentrate or make decisions | 1, I occasionally feel indecisive or find that my attention wanders | 2, Most of the time, I struggle to focus my attention or to make decisions | 3, I cannot concentrate well enough to read or cannot make even minor decisions

Field Label: 18. View of myself
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I see myself as equally worthwhile and deserving as other people | 1, I am more self-blaming than usual | 2, I largely believe that I cause problems for others | 3, I think almost constantly about major and minor defects in myself

Field Label: 19. View of my future
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I have an optimistic view of my future | 1, I am occasionally pessimistic about my future, but for the most part I believe things will get better | 2, I am pretty certain that my immediate future (1-2 months) does not hold much promise of good things for me | 3, I see no hope of anything good happening to me anytime in the future

Field Label: 20. Thoughts of death or suicide
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I do not think of suicide or death | 1, I feel that life is empty or wonder if it is worth living | 2, I think of suicide or death several times a week for several minutes | 3, I think of suicide or death several times a day in some detail, or I have made specific plans for suicide or have actually tried to take my life

Field Label: 21. General interest
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, There is no change from usual in how interested I am in other people or activities | 1, I notice that I am less interested in people or activities | 2, I find I have interest in only one or two of my formerly pursued activities | 3, I have virtually no interest in formerly pursued activities

Field Label: 22. Energy level
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, There is no change in my usual level of energy | 1, I get tired more easily than usual | 2, I have to make a big effort to start or finish my usual daily activities (e.g,shopping, homework, cooking or going to work) | 3, I really cannot carry our most of my usual daily activities because I just do not have the energy

Field Label: 23. Capacity for pleasure or enjoyment (excluding sex)
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I enjoy pleasurable activities just as much as usual | 1, I do not feel my usual sense of enjoyment from pleasurable activities | 2, I rarely get a feeling of pleasure from any activity | 3, I am unable to get pleasure or enjoyment from anything

Field Label: 24. Interest in sex (please rate interest not activity)
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I am just as interested in sex as usual | 1, My interest in sex is somewhat less than usual or I do not get the same pleasure from sex as I used to | 2, I have little desire for or rarely derive pleasure from sex | 3, I have absolutely no interest in or derive no pleasure from sex

Field Label: 25. Feeling slowed down
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I think, speak, and move at my usual rate of speed | 1, I find that my thinking is slowed down or my voice sounds dull or flat | 2, It takes me several seconds to respond to most questions and I am sure my thinking is slowed | 3, I am often unable to respond to questions without extreme effort

Field Label: 26. Feeling restless
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I do not feel restless | 1, I am often fidgety, wring my hands, or need to shift how I'm sitting | 2, I have impulses to move about and am quite restless | 3, At times, I am unable to stay seated and need to pace around

Field Label: 27. Aches and pains
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I do not have any feeling of heaviness in my arms or legs and I do not have any aches or pains | 1, Sometimes I get headaches or pains in my stomach, back or joints but these pains are only sometimes | 2, I have these sorts of pains most of the time | 3, These pains are so bad, they force me to stop what I'm doing

Field Label: 28. Other bodily symptoms
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I do not have any of these symptoms: heart pounding fast, blurred vision, sweating, hot and cold flashes, chest pain, heart turning over in my chest, ringing in my ears, or shaking | 1, I have some of these symptoms but they are mild and are present only sometimes | 2, I have several of these symptoms and they bother me quite a lot | 3, I have several of these symptoms and when they occur I have to stop doing whatever I am doing

Field Label: 29. Panic/phobic symptoms
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I have no spells of panic of specific fears (phobia) (such as animals of heights) | 1, I have mild panic episodes or fears that do not usually change my behaviour or stop me from functioning | 2, I have significant panic episodes or fears that force me to change my behaviour but do not stop me from functioning | 3, I have panic episodes at least once a week or severe fears that stop me from carrying on my daily activities

Field Label: 30. Constipation/diarrhoea
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, There is no change in my usual bowel habits | 1, I have intermittent constipation or diarrhoea which is mild | 2, I have intermittent constipation or diarrhoea most of the time but it does not interfere with my day-to-day functioning | 3, I have constipation or diarrhoea for which I take medicating or which interferes with my day-to-day activities

Field Label: 31. Interpersonal sensitivity
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I have not felt easily rejected, slighted, criticised or hurt by others at all | 1, I have occasionally felt rejected, slighted, criticised or hurt by others | 2, I have often felt rejected, slighted, criticised or hurt by others, but these feelings have only had slight effects on my relationships or work | 3, I have often felt rejected, slighted, criticised or hurt by others and these feelings have impaired my relationships and work

Field Label: 32. Leaden paralysis/physical energy.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, I have not experienced the physical sensation of feeling weighted down and without physical energy | 1, I have occasionally experienced periods of feeling physically weighted down and without physical energy, but without a negative effect on work, school, or activity level | 2, I feel physically weighted down (without physical energy) more than half the time | 3, I feel physically weighted down (without physical energy) most of the time, several hours per day, several days per week

Section Header: These questions are about periods of sadness or depression you might have experienced since your last assessment.
Field Label: Since your last assessment, has there been a period when you felt sad, empty or depressed for two weeks or longer?
Think about a period of two weeks since your last assessment when feeling sad, empty or depressed was worst. During this period of two weeks, how often did you feel this way?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Almost every day, most of the day | 1, Less often

Field Label: Since your last assessment, has there been a period lasting two weeks or more when you lost interest in most things like hobbies, work, or activities that usually give you pleasure?
Think about the period of two weeks since your last assessment when your loss of interest was worst. During this period of two weeks, how often did you feel this way?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Almost every day, most of the day | 1, Less often

Field Label: During the period that you felt sad, empty or depressed, did you ever have a period lasting two weeks or more when you lost interest in most things like hobbies, work, or activities that usually give you pleasure?
Think about the period of two weeks since your last assessment when your loss of interest was worst. During this period of two weeks, how often did you feel this way?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Almost every day, most of the day | 1, Less often

Section Header: People who have periods in which they feel sad, empty or depressed or lose interest, often have other problems at the same time. During this period of at least two weeks since your last assessment when you felt sad, empty or depressed or lost interest in things:
Field Label: Did you lack energy or feel tired more than usual?
Did you have less appetite than usual almost every day?
Did you lose weight without trying to, as much as a kilo a week for several weeks?
About how much weight did you lose in those weeks? (kg)

Section Header: During this period of at least two weeks since your last assessment when you felt sad, empty or depressed or lost interest in things:
Field Label: Did you have a much larger appetite than usual almost every day for two weeks or more?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Yes | 1, Yes but only because of a pregnancy of growth spurt | 2, No

Field Label: Did your eating increase so much that you gained weight, as much as a kilo a week for several weeks?
About how much weight did you gain in those weeks? (kg)
Did you have trouble sleeping almost every night, either trouble falling asleep, waking in the middle of the night, or waking up too early?
Did you wake up at least two hours before you wanted to, every day for at least two weeks?
Were you sleeping too much almost every day?
Did you talk or move more slowly than is normal for you almost every day, in a way that other people have noticed?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Yes, I talked or moved more slowly and other people did notice | 1, Yes, I talked or moved more slowly but other people did not notice | 2, No

Field Label: Did you have to be moving all the time, that is, you could not sit still and paced up and down or couldn't keep your hands still when sitting, in a way that other people noticed?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Yes, I had to be moving all the time and other people did notice | 1, Yes, I had to be moving all the time but other people did not notice | 2, No

Field Label: During this period of two weeks, did you have a lot more trouble concentrating than usual?
During this period, were you able to make up your mind about things you ordinarily had no trouble deciding about?
People sometimes feel down on themselves, no good, or worthless. During this period of two weeks, did you feel guilty or worthless?
During this period of two weeks, did you think a lot about death - either your own, someone else's, or death in general?

Section Header: For the next question, please think about the periods of at least two weeks since your last assessment when you felt sad, empty or depressed or lost interest in things.
Field Label: Did any period lasting two weeks or longer seriously interfere with your ability to do your job, take care of your house or family, or take care of yourself?
About how long did this period last? (In weeks, you may give an estimate).
Did you tell a professional about these problems (for example a medical doctor, psychologist, social worker, nurse, or other helping professional)?
Have you had contact with a social service organisation for problems that you had that were not related to your physical health? (for example a mental health institute, psychologist, or social work)
Have you been diagnosed as having one of the following  by a professional or medical doctor ? You can tick more than one answer.

Have you received treatment for any of the following by a professional or medical doctor. You can tick more than one answer.
